newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SS Land awards building contracts.
newsitem.headline: SS Land awards building contracts.

text.p: Property developer Straits Steamship Land Ltd said on Tuesday it had awarded two large contracts for the construction of office developments in Singapore to Ssangyong Engineering and Construction Co Ltd and Nishimatsu Lum Chang JV Pte Ltd.
SSL said in a statement Korea's Ssangyong Engineering and Construction Co Ltd had been awarded a Singapore $92 million contract.
Nishimatsu Lum Chang, a joint venture of Japan's Nishimatsu Construction Co Ltd and Singapore-based Lum Chang Holdings, had been awarded work worth S$71 million.
The contracts were for the construction of Prudential Tower, a 30-storey office block, a public park and an underpass.
Total development costs for Prudential Tower would be about S$460 million, it said.
Nishimatsu Lum Chang would be the main contractor responsible for Prudential Tower.
Ssangyong would be responsible for the construction of a second office tower, Parcel E, to be 16 storeys high with associated shophouses.
The total development cost of Parcel E would be S$570 million, it said.
SSL is a unit of Singapore marine-based conglomerate Keppel Corp.
